subject: Re: [junit] assertNotEquals or equivlant method
msgSnippet: There aren t any standard ones that I know of but they re easy to write.  The assertEquals() method is overloaded because (1) until Java 5.0/1.5, primitives
messageBody:
There aren't any standard ones that I know of but they're easy to
write. The assertEquals() method is overloaded because (1) until Java
5.0/1.5, primitives can't be passed as objects without effort, (2)
floats and doubles have a special interpretation of "equals", and (3) it
has special message handling when both arguments are Strings.

Scott


Fazle Khan wrote:

> While writing testcode I enountered a situation that I wanted to do
> an assertNotEquals(Object,Object) to verify that two object where in
> fact not equal. Is there such a method?
>
> My work around was to do
>
> if(!(object1.equals(object2))){
> fail("objects are equals");
> }
>
> On a side note why is the assert method overloaded? If the method
> signature were more generically assert(String,Object,Object)
> shouldn't the polymorphic nature of Java resolve the equals methods
> to the correct equals call?
>
> -Fazle
